oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Discussion - Let's Trade a Little - 2004-03-27
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Panel discussion about the intersection of Country and R&B music from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on February 27, 2004. In support of the exhibit "Night Train to Nashville: Music City Rhythm and Blues".
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bobby Hebb; Buddy Killen; Shelby S. Singleton; Eugenia Sweeney; Audrey Bryant;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Discussion moderated by Michael Gray. Includes recorded audio excerpts. Includes questions from the audience. Opening comments by Michael Gray. Introduction of participants. Subjects include; Bobby Hebb talks about his family and musical beginnings -- Beginnings at the Bijou Theater -- Owen Bradley television show -- Hearing country music growing up -- Becoming a member of Roy Acuff's band -- Joe Zinkan - Traveling with a mixed race group -- Songwriting advice from Hank Williams -- Buddy Killen talks about working with Joe Tex -- Starting Dial Records -- Recording at Fame studios in Muscle Shoals, Alabama -- Story behind the recording of Hold On To What You Got -- Respect between country artists/musicians and r&b artists/musicians -- Shelby Singleton talks about bringing r&b artists to Nashville to record -- Artists reaction to working with Nashville musicians versus New York musicians -- Shelby's recording work in Nashville and bringing different acts to Nashville --

Eugenia Sweeney talks about working with songwriter Eddie Miller -- Influence of her father Jimmy Sweeney -- Audrey Bryant talks about being the first African American female as a regular on Nashville television -- Background of her appearances on the Noel Ball television show -- Her performance history -- Appearances on album covers and mentions of many clubs she appeared in -- Meeting Chet Atkins and being offered a RCA record contract -- Audrey's relationship with Jimi Hendrix -- Closing.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Gray, Michael; Hebb, Bobby; Killen, Buddy; Singleton, Shelby S.; Sweeney, Eugenia; Bryant, Audrey; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
